title: openrtb-v2_5-schema-bid_request
description: json schema for an openrtb v2.5 bid request

id.description: Unique ID of the bid request, provided by the exchange.

imp.description: Array of “Imp” objects representing the impressions offered.  At least 1 “Imp” object is required.

site.description: Details via a “Site” object about the publisher’s website.  Only applicable and recommended for websites.

app.description: Details via an “App” object about the publisher’s app (i.e., non-browser applications).  Only applicable and recommended for apps.

device.description: Details via a “Device” object about the user’s device to which the impression will be delivered.

user.description: Details via a “User” about the human user of the device; the advertising audience.

test.description: Indicator of test mode in which auctions are not billable, where 0 = live mode, 1 = test mode.

at.description: Auction type, where 1 = First Price, 2 = Second Price Plus.  Exchange-specific auction types can be defined using values greater than 500.

tmax.description: Maximum time in milliseconds the exchange allows for bids to be received including internet latency to avoid timeout.  This value supersedes any a priori guidance from the exchange.

wseat.description: White list of buyer seats (e.g., advertisers, agencies) allowed to bid on this impression.  IDs of seats and knowledge of the buyer’s customers to which they refer must be coordinated between bidders and the exchange a priori.  At most, only one of “wseat” and “bseat” should be used in the same request.  Omission of both implies no seat restrictions.

bseat.description: Block list of buyer seats (e.g., advertisers, agencies) restricted from bidding on this impression.  IDs of seats and knowledge of the buyer’s customers to which they refer must be coordinated between bidders and the exchange a priori.  At most, only one of wseat and bseat should be used in the same request.  Omission of both implies no seat restrictions.

allimps.description: Flag to indicate if exchange can verify that the impressions offered represent all of the impressions available in context (e.g., all on the web page, all video spots such as pre/mid/postroll) to support road-blocking.  0 = no or unknown, 1 = yes, the impressions offered represent all that are available.

cur.description: Array of allowed currencies for bids on this bid request using ISO-4217 alpha codes.  Recommended only if the exchange accepts multiple currencies.

wlang.description: White list of languages for creatives using ISO-639-1-alpha-2.  Omission implies no specific restrictions, but buyers would be advised to consider language attribute in the “Device” and/or “Content” objects if available.

bcat.description: Blocked advertiser categories using the IAB content categories.

badv.description: Block list of advertisers by their domains (e.g., “ford.com”).

bapp.description: Block list of applications by their platform-specific exchange-independent application identifiers.  On Android, these should be bundle or package names (e.g., com.foo.mygame).  On iOS, these are numeric IDs.

source.description: A “Source” object that provides data about the inventory source and which entity makes the final decision.

regs.description: A “Regs” object that specifiesany industry, legal, or governmental regulations in force for this request.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

id.description: A unique identifier for this impression within the context of the bid request. Typically, starts with 1 and increments.

banner.description: A “Banner” object required if this impression is offered as a banner ad opportunity.

video.description: A “Video” object; required if this impression is offered as a video ad opportunity.

audio.description: An “Audio” object; required if this impression is offered as an audio ad opportunity.

native.description: A “Native” object; required if this impression is offered as a native ad opportunity.

pmp.description: A “Pmp” object containing any private marketplace deals in effect for this impression.

displaymanager.description: Name of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile).  Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner.  Recommended for video and/or apps.

displaymanagerver.description: Version of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile).  Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner.  Recommended for video and/or apps.

instl.description: 1 = the ad is interstitial or full screen, 0 = not interstitial.

tagid.description: Identifier for specific ad placement or ad tag that was used to initiate the auction.  This can be useful for debugging of any issues, or for optimization by the buyer.

bidfloor.description: Minimum bid for this impression expressed in CPM.

bidfloorcur.description: Currency specified using ISO-4217 alpha codes.  This may be different from bid currency returned by bidder if this is allowed by the exchange.

clickbrowser.description: Indicates the type of browser opened upon clicking the creative in an app, where 0 = embedded, 1 = native.  Note that the Safari View Controller in iOS 9.x devices is considered a native browser for purposes of this attribute.

secure.description: Flag to indicate if the impression requires secure HTTPS URL creative assets and markup, where 0 = non-secure, 1 = secure.  If omitted, the secure state is unknown, but non-secure HTTP support can be assumed.

iframebuster.description: Array of exchange-specific names of supported iframe busters.

exp.description: Advisory as to the number of seconds that may elapse between the auction and the actual impression.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

type.description: Type of metric being presented using exchange curated string names which should be published to bidders a priori.

value.description: Number representing the value of the metric.  Probabilities must be in the range 0.0 - 1.0.

vendor.description: Source of the value using exchange curated string names which should be published to bidders a priori. If the exchange itself is the source versus a third party, “EXCHANGE” is recommended.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

format.description: Array of “Format” objects representing the banner sizes permitted.  If none are specified, then use of the “h” and “w” attributes is highly recommended.

w.description: Exact width in device independent pixels (DIPS); recommended if no “format” objects are specified.

h.description: Exact width in device independent pixels (DIPS); recommended if no “format” objects are specified.

wmax.description: NOTE:  Deprecated in favor of the “format” array. Maximum width in device independent pixels (DIPS).

hmax.description: NOTE:  Deprecated in favor of the “format” array. Maximum height in device independent pixels (DIPS).

wmin.description: NOTE:  Deprecated in favor of the “format” array. Minimum width in device independent pixels (DIPS).

hmin.description: NOTE:  Deprecated in favor of the “format” array. Minimum height in device independent pixels (DIPS).

mimes.description: Content MIME types supported.  Popular MIME types may include “application/x-shockwave-flash”, “image/jpg” and “image/gif”.

topframe.description: Indicates if the banner is in the top frame as opposed to an iframe, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.

expdir.description: Directions in which the banner may expand.

api.description: List of supported API frameworks for this impression. If an API is not explicitly listed, it is assumed not to be supported.

id.description: Unique identifier for this banner object. Recommended when “Banner” objects are used with a “Video” object to represent an array of companion ads. Values usually start at 1 and increase with each object; should be unique within an impression.

vcm.description: Relevant only for “Banner” objects used with a “Video” object in an array of companion ads. Indicates the companion banner rendering mode relative to the associated video, where 0 = concurrent, 1 = end-card.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

format.description: represents an allowed size for a banner impression

wratio.description: Relative width when expressing size as a ratio.

hratio.description: Relative heightwhen expressing size as a ratio.

wmin.description: The minimum width in device independent pixels (DIPS) at which the ad will be displayed the size is expressed as a ratio.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

name.description: Site name (may be aliased at the publisher’s request).

cat.description: Array of IAB content categories of the site.

sectioncat.description: Array of IAB content categories that describe the current section of the site.

pagecat.description: Array of IAB content categories that describe the current page or view of the site.

page.description: URL of the page where the impression will be shown.

ref.description: Referrer URL that caused navigation to the current page.

search.description: Search string that caused navigation to the current page.

mobile.description: Indicates if the site has been programmed to optimize layout when viewed on mobile devices, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.

privacypolicy.description: Indicates if the site has a privacy policy, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.

publisher.description: Details about the “Publisher” of the site.

content.description: Details about the “Content” within the site.

keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywordsabout the site.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

geo.description: Location of the device assumed to be the user’s current location defined by a “Geo” object.

dnt.description: Standard “Do Not Track” flag as set in the header by the browser, where 0 = tracking is unrestricted, 1 = do not track.

lmt.description: “Limit Ad Tracking” signal commercially endorsed (e.g., iOS, Android), where 0 = tracking is unrestricted, 1 = tracking must be limited per commercial guidelines.

ipv6.description: IP address closest to device as IPv6.

hwv.description: Hardware version of the device (e.g., “5S” for iPhone 5S).

h.description: Physical height of the screen in pixels.

w.description: Physical width of the screen in pixels.

ppi.description: Screen size as pixels per linear inch.

pxratio.description: The ratio of physical pixels to device independent pixels.

js.description: Support for JavaScript, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.

geofetch.description: Indicates if the geolocation API will be available to JavaScript code running in the banner, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.

flashver.description: Version of Flash supported by the browser.

carrier.description: Carrier or ISP (e.g., “VERIZON”) using exchange curated string names which should be published to bidders a priori.

mccmnc.description: Mobile carrier as the concatenated MCC-MNC code (e.g., “310-005” identifies Verizon Wireless CDMA in the USA). Refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_country_code for further examples. Note that the dash between the MCC and MNC parts is required to remove parsing ambiguity.

ifa.description: ID sanctioned for advertiser use in the clear (i.e., not hashed).

didsha1.description: Hardware device ID (e.g., IMEI); hashed via SHA1.

didmd5.description: Hardware device ID (e.g., IMEI); hashed via MD5.

dpidsha1.description: Platform device ID (e.g., Android ID); hashed via SHA1.

dpidmd5.description: Platform device ID (e.g., Android ID); hashed via MD5.

macsha1.description: MAC address of the device; hashed via SHA1.

macmd5.description: MAC addressof the device; hashed via MD5.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

fd.description: Entity responsible for the final impression sale decision, where 0 = exchange, 1 = upstream source.

tid.description: Transaction ID that must be common across all participants in this bid request (e.g., potentially multiple exchanges).

pchain.description: Payment ID chain string containing embedded syntax described in the TAG Payment ID Protocol v1.0.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

coppa.description: Flag indicating if this request is subject to the COPPA regulations established by the USA FTC, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.  Refer to Section 7.5for more information.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.
